($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, posyselfriti for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.
$x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}). See also {cmila}, {cisma}.
sumti place tag: tag 5th sumti place.
reverse Polish mathematical expression (mex) operator flag.
$c_1$ blames/holds responsible/accuses $f_1$ for action/state $f_2$ from authority $f_3$ to audience $c_3$ with expression medium $c_4$.
$v_1=f_1$ is a loan-word with meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$, based on foreign-language word $f_2$
$x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$f_1=z_1=p_1$ holds the copyright for copying $f_2=p_2$ under law $p_3$.

"Copyright" itself might be "si'o fukzifypo'e".
If you are actually translating something with a copyright notice, you should leave the notice in the original language.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied).
end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
zgana modal, 1st place to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.

$x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.
$g_1$=$z_1$ perceives $z_2$ to have quality $g_2$ by means/sense $g_3$=$z_3$ under conditions $g_4$=$z_4$.
attitudinal modifier/honorific: hauteur - equal rank - meekness; used with one of lower rank.
$x_1=m_1$ is December of year $x_2=m_2$ in calendar $x_3=m_3$.
Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}). (cf. stika for non-resultative, binxo for not-necessarily causal change, cenba for non-resultative change; zasni)
$gas_1$ elevates/raises $gal_1$ by height reference $gal_2$ and height standard $gal_3$.
$x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_1$ is December/twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$
Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {gai} (gam). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavrelma'i}
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.
$x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus property $x_{2}$ (ka) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.

$x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel. See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].
Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) $x_1$ is anal. See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.
$x_{1}$ organizes $x_{2}$ [relative chaos] into $x_{3}$ [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_3$ is also a system; $x_4$ could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of $x_3$. See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.
closed interval bracket marker; mod. intervals in non-logical connectives; include boundaries.
$x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_3$ includes temperature and pressure. See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.
(cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including $x_{2}$.
gasnu modal, 1st place agent/actor case tag with active agent ...
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal and (with gi).
mathematical operator: null mathematical expression (mex) operator (used in >2-ary ops).
attitudinal: elliptical/unspecified/non-specific emotion; no particular feeling.
trinary mathematical operator: order of magnitude/value/base; [b * (c to the a power)].
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal connective question (with gi).
$d_1$ is grammatically correct in situation $d_2$ according to grammar $d_3=g_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a root [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing].
$x_1=f_1$ parses text $x_3=g_3=f_3$ according to formal grammar $x_2=g_1$.
$x_{1}$ is the grammar/rules/defining form of language $x_{2}$ for structure/text $x_{3}$.
elidable terminator: end relative/modal phrases; usually elidable in non-complex phrases.
logical connective: all but tanru-internal forethought connective medial marker.

A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated. See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.
$x_{1}$ is a billion [British milliard] [1$x_{1}$0**9] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought conn question.
$x_{1}$ is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) $x_{2}$ due to set $x_{3}$ linked by relations $x_{4}$.

Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members $x_3$ (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group $x_1$; cluster (= {kangri}). See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.
$x_{1}$ is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation $x_{2}$ among argument roles $x_{3}$, with affix(es) $x_{4}$.

Gismu list, if physical object (= (loi) gimste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = gimpoi, gimselcmi, gimselste). See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of thermodymanics / science of / about heat / heating based on methodology $s_3$.
Made from {glare} and {saske}. saske2 and all places of glare subsumed.
zoi gy. musth .gy steci lo xanto
$c_1$ is pornography/erotica about plot/theme/subject/under convention $c_2$ by author $c_3$.
$x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetrical; mounts (= {cpanygle}). See also {cinse}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {speni}.
$x_1$ is a prositute offering his/her services to $x_2$ for $x_3$ (payment).
$g_1=b_1$ is the English language, used by $b_2$ to communicate $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_{2}$.

Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}). (cf. brito which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, merko, sralo, kadno, skoto)
$x_1$ is an England of peoples $x_2$ with territory $x_3$, being English in aspect $x_4$.
$x_1$ is an English person / is a person that shows traits $x_2$ related to England / English culture.
$x_{1}$ is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material $x_{2}$.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru internal biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if(with gi).
pro-bridi: repeats a recent bridi (usually not the last 2).
$x_{1}$ is 1$x_{1}$0**-24 of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
pro-bridi: repeats the next to last bridi.
sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.
pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.
pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.
$x_{1}$ is 1$x_{1}$0**24 of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.
$x_{1}$ [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard $x_{2}$ (si'o) measuring property $x_{3}$.
Also grade, level, point; $x_3$ dimension. See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_1=k_1$ is a hole in $x_2=k_2=p_2$ to/between $x_3=p_3$ from/and $x_4=p_4$ permitting passage by $x_5=p_1$.

{pagre} + {kevna}. Precisely, $x_2$ is the barrier, $x_3$ is the inside, and $x_4$ is the outside, if distinguishable; loosely, $x_2$ might be given as the object consisting of both the barrier and the inside.
$x_{1}$ is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of $x_{2}$.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).
$x_{1}$ is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community $x_{2}$ (mass).
$c_1$ votes (in a public election) for $c_2$ among choices $c_3$ in electorate $g_2$.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought and (with gi).
$x_{1}$ is the country of peoples $x_{2}$ with land/territory $x_{3}$; (people/territory relationship).
Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethos). See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.
$x_1$ migrates to country $x_2$ from country $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).
$x_{1}$ is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing $x_{2}$ by process/means $x_{3}$.
Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer. (cf. sazri, gasnu, se jibri; zukte - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = ni muvyselbai, briju, jibri, lazni, selfu)
$x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.

A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi. See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.
$x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.
$x_{1}$ (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim $x_{2}$ with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if (with gi).
$x_1=ga_1$ rolls object $x_2=gu_1$ on/against surface $x_3=gu_2$, with axis/ axle of rotation $x_4=gu_3$.
$x_{1}$ [energy] is light/illumination illuminating $x_{2}$ from light source $x_{3}$.

$x_3$ illuminates/lights $x_2$ with light/illumination $x_1$; $x_2$ is lit/illuminated by illumination $x_1$ from source $x_3$ (= selgu'i for reordered {places}); light/lamp (= {tergu'i}) See also {dirce}, {manku}, {solri}, {carmi}, {ctino}, {kantu}.
$x_{1}$ is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a lightning bug/glowworm/firefly of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.

Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}). (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought whether-or-not (with gi).
sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.
attitudinal: love - no love lost - hatred.
bridi logical affirmer; scope is an entire bridi.
affirm last word: attached to cmavo to affirm them; denies negation by nai whenever it is applicable.
Suggested by Mark Shoulson in 1999 as an affirmative of {nai}. By analogy with the pairs {na}/{ja'a}, {na'e}/{je'a}, and {na'i}/{jo'a}.
$x_{1}$ brakes/causes to slow motion/activity $x_{2}$ with device/mechanism/principle $x_{3}$.
$j_1=t_1$ is a tubular chime of material $t_2$, hollow with $t_3$, producing sound/note $j_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degrees Celsius / centigrade in temperature by standard $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a waterway to $p_2$ from $p_3$ via/defined by points including $p_4$ (set).
$x_{1}$ (object) adorns/decorates $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an adornment/decoration of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is fancy/decorated.
jalge modal, 1st place resultingly; therefore result ...
convert tense/modal (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra FA place (fai).
javni modal, 1st place (by standard 1) orderly; by rule ...
$x_{1}$ is a rocket [vehicle] propelled by jet expelling $x_{2}$ carrying payload $x_{3}$.

Also: $x_2$ gives rise to $x_1$ (= selja'e for reordered {places}); total (general meaning, but also = mekyja'e, pi'irja'e, sujyja'e). See also se {mukti}, te {zukte}, se {rinka}, se {krinu}, se {nibli}, {mulno}, {sumji}, {pilji}, {mekso}, cmavo list {ja'e}, {ciksi}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of starch from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.

Also grasshopper (= {pipyjalra}); cricket (= {sanjalra}); locust, termite (= mantyjalra or {mudyctijalra}). (while cockroaches are an order unto themselves, they are part of Orthoptera, which includes grasshoppers, crickets, etc; termites are a closely-related non-Orthoptera, more akin to cockroaches than to e.g. ants); See also {cinki}, {civla}, {manti}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the foot [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: lowest portion] (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is pedal.
$x_{1}$ (person/mass) wars against $x_{2}$ over territory/matter $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is at war with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bell/chime/[tuning fork] [tuned percussion instrument] producing sound/note $x_{2}$.
Also: $x_1$ rings/tolls (i.e. if it rings, then it is a bell); resonates (one sense, = jabdesku). See also {zgike}, {tonga}, {desku}, {slilu}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the shoulder/hip/joint [body-part] attaching limb/extremity $x_{2}$ to body $x_{3}$.
(also collide = simjanli for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.
$x_{1}$ is a diplomat/consul representing polity $x_{2}$ in/at negotiation $x_{3}$ for function/purpose $x_{4}$.
(for) $x_3$ polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}). See also {jecta}, {krati}.
$x_{1}$ is an account/bill/invoice for goods/services $x_{2}$, billed to $x_{3}$ by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a suburban area of city/metropolis $x_{2}$.

[reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: $x_1$ shows that $x_2$, $x_1$ shows off $x_2$; showing an object is generally expressed with a {tu'a} $x_2$, since the properties of the shown object (other than its presence) intended for observation are seldom specified (simple presence could be expressed by {leka} Object. {cu} {zvati})]; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.
$x_{1}$ is narrow in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a passport issued to $x_{2}$ (person) by authority $x_{3}$ allowing $x_{4}$ (activity).
$x_1$ is February of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$j_1=x_1$ is a/the beak/talon-like jaw (body part) of $j_2=x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.

Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated. See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.
$x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
$x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day. See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.
$x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}). See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.
$k_1$ approaches $j_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$ by means of transportation $k_5$.
$x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).

$x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$. See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.
$x_1$ is a neighbo(u)r of / living close/near to $x_2$.
A computer program that parses Lojban text. Cf. {lojbo}, {finpe}, {genturfa'i}.
$x_{1}$ is a Lojbanic group/organization with role/purpose/function $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ uses Lojban for purpose $p_2; $p_1$ is a Lojbanist.
$l_1=v_1$ is a child who is a native speaker of Lojban.
A web-based Lojban dictionary editing system, and the contents of its dictionary. Cf. {lojbo}, {valsi}, {liste}, {vlaste}, {vlacku}
$b_1$ is a congregation of believers of religion $j_1$.
$x_1=c_1$ is a scripture/religious book of religion $x_4=c_4=l_2$ containing text $x_2=c_2$ written by $x_3=c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$c_2$ is a prayer of believer $c_1=l_2$ for deity $c_3$ in medium $c_4$ according to religion $l_3$.
$s_1$ is a paladin/holy warrior of army $s_2$, and with religion $l_1$.
$z_1$ is a sin/blasphemy according to religion $z_2=j_1$.
$x_1$ is a warning message to intended audience $x_2$ about danger $x_3$ from author $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.

$x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, posyseldi'a for unambiguous {semantics}); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as "value" or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, vamji for {'value'}, ve vecnu for {'cost'}, {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.
$x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}). See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}, {rupnu}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
$x_1$ is political/pertains to the politics of territory/domain $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; used to acknowledge offers and thanks.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.

Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = jelka'e or jelfrili). See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.
$x_{1}$ is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type $x_{2}$ from gemstone/material/source $x_{3}$.

Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or jmero'i, jmekunra); pearl (= selcakyjme - a gem found inside a shell, tercakyjme - a gem made of shell material, boijme - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}). See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.
$x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is an army serving group/community $x_{2}$ (mass) in function $x_{3}$ (activity).

Also $x_2$ earnings, reward (= zanseljerna or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); $x_3$ behavior; job (= {terjerna}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, posyseljerna for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.
$x_{1}$ chases/pursues/(physically) follows after $x_{2}$; volition is not implied for $x_{1}$ or $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a hedgehog/spiny anteater of species $x_2$.
general term for spiny mammals; see also {ernace}, {zalgosu}, {jesyratcu}
$x_{1}$ is a jet [expelled stream] of material $x_{2}$ expelled from $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ has truth-value $x_2$ under metaphysics $x_3$ on scale $x_4$.
Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].
$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.
Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval). See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.
$x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); embrace (= {xadjai}); handshake (= {xanjai}, {jikyxanjai}), handle (= {veljai}, {veljaitci}). See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.
Knot (verb = jgegau, jgezu'e, jgeri'a, jgela'a), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}). See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.
$j_1=j_2=n_1$ is a pretzel made from grains $n_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.

An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone. See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.
$x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
Also lute, viola, cello. See also {zgike}.
logical connective: sumti afterthought connective question.
$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.

Working for another (= {selplijibri}). See also {briju}, {gunka}, te jerna which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for {another}, te pilno which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for {another}, se gasnu and se zukte for incidental {activities}.
$x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.

$x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= selcmu for reordered {places}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects). See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.
$x_1$ is cladistics about organisms $x_2$ according to $x_3$.
jimte modal, 1st place limitedly; up to limit ...
$x_1$ resurrects/brings back to life $x_2=j_1$ by standard $j_2$.
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).
$j_1=c_1$ expresses/says opinion $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) about subject/issue $j_3$ to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ on grounds $j_4$.
Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.
$x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ commits faux pas (social error) $s_2$, which is wrong under conditions $s_3$ according to standard $s_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$j_1$=$b_1$ is a prosthetic bone made of metal, performing function $b_2$ in body $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$s_1$ is a zing/clang produced by metal $j_1=d_2=s_2$ being hit.
$x_1$ is Friday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.
Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}). See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.
$x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.

Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, posyselji'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.
$x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.
Also serum; inoculation (= jestu'u {veljinku}). See also {jurme}, {mikce}, {jesni}, {bilma}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$d_1=s_1$ is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing $s_2$ near total containment in some dimension(s).
$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.
jitro modal, 1st place (control) controlledly; under direction of ...
$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a vertex of polytope $x_2$ at locus $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.
Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

$x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = gunterbe'e, gunja'a, gunmi'e, gunca'i). (cf. cmavo list ji'o, bapli, te bende, gidva - which does not necessarily control or command, jatna, macnu, minde, ponse, ralju, rinka, sazri, turni, vlipa, xance, xlura)
jicmu modal, 1st place (assumptions); given that ...; based on ...
$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.

Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external). See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.
$v_1$ is a pedal with function $v_2$, fulcrum $x_3$, and lever arm $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
$g_1$ causes $j_1$ to be joined to/connected to/united with $j_2$ at common locus $j_3$.
$x_1$ is the union of sets $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is joined to/connects to/is united with $x_{2}$ at common locus $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ are a union.

Also joined/fastened/attached by joint $x_3$/by means of $x_3$/with fastener $x_3$; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= jonpoi; porjo'e for a single object joined into a sequence). See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.
non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).
$x_{1}$ is a table/flat solid upper surface of material $x_{2}$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ pay attention to $x_3$; $x_1$ directs $x_2$'s attention to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an address of/are coordinates of $x_{2}$ in system $x_{3}$.
vague non-logical connective: analogous to plain ".i".
$x_1$ is a paragraph about $x_2$ including sentence(s) $x_3$.
$p_1$ is a phrase of sentence $p_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.
$s_1$ is a fragment of sentence $s_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$x_1$ is a Chinese character in writing system $x_2$ (traditional/simplified/bopomofo/etc.) meaning $x_3$.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}). See also {cupra}, {bredi}.
$x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ tells/makes known to $x_2$ fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is clock/watch/timer measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
some trees called "cedar" are actually juniper; see {ricrcedro}, {ckunu}
$x_{1}$ is the weight of object $x_{2}$ in [gravitational or other force] field $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bacteria/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a species of genus $x_{2}$, family $x_{3}$, etc.; [open-ended tree-structure categorization].

Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, $x_1$ is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than $x_2$, $x_2$ is "lower" than $x_3$, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy. See also {klesi}, {lanzu}.
binary mathematical operator: number base; [a interpreted in the base b].
$l_1$ is a regular/predictable lujvo (compound predicate word) with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from phrase $l_4$ and having an argument structure according to rule $j_1$.

A Lojban-specific term. The approach of \emph{jvajvo} is intended to at least constrain what the $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$... etc. of a lujvo may be, and also to draw the semantic values of those places from the semantic values of the places of the component brivla. The rationale is that the place structure of an unknown {lujvo} should not require memorization. This was previously known as ``{dikyjvo}''; a mistranslation of ``regular lujvo'', as it used the wrong sense of ``regular'' (see {dikni}).
$x_{1}$ is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of $x_{2}$ (object/location) from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
Also $x_1$ is on display to $x_2$/$x_3$. See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.
$xi_1$ is a racehorse of breed $xi_2$ competing in race $j_3$.
$k_1$ separates affix compound $k_2$ into its constituent affixes $k_3$; $k_1$ does morphological analysis.
abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
klama modal, 1st place gone to by ...
$m_1$ is an axe for cutting $k_2$ with blade $m_3=k_1$ propelled by $m_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not. See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.
$x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a photograph of $p_2$ taken by photographer $p_3$ in medium $p_4$=$k_3$.
$p_1$ is a sequence of numbers in ascending order.
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
$x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}). See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.
$x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}). (cf. stati, certu, gasnu (in the time-free potential sense), cmavo list ka'e, cmavo list nu'o, cmavo list pu'i, djuno, zifre)
Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal). See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.
$c_1=k_4$ is an excavator/bulldozer for digging in $k_3$, operated by $k_1=c_3$.
$x_1$ is a teardrop wept by $x_2$ for reason $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}). See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.
$m_1$ tests/evaluates/measures $j_1$'s knowledge of facts (du'u) $j_2$ in subject area $j_3$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$
The x2 through x4 places are = m2
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).

Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$. For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}. See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.
$k_1$ is the fatigue of $t_1$ in being/doing $t_2$ (event).
$x_1$ is January of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.

In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness). See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default li so'a (i.e. near 1)); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.

Notes: The value of x3 is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to x1, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see pacna. kanpe with x3 not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("li piso'u" to "li piro"); non-desirous wish (= ??), non-desirous hope (= ??); (cf. djica, pacna)
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}). (cf. selci for masses and most objects; ratni, gradu, gusni, nejni, linji)
$x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
$x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ opens portal/passage/entranceway $k_1$, permitting access to $k_2$ by $k_3$.

$x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= poskargu for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.
$x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
$x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list. See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.
$x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd issue/number of journal/periodical/magazine/publication $x_2$ with content $x_4$ published by $x_5$ for audience $x_6$ .

For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}). (cf. kakpa, sraku for cutting into without division; plixa, dakfu, jinci, porpi, spofu, tunta, xrani, fatri, fendi, balre, dilcu)
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
$x_1$ scores/gains a point against $x_2$ in competition/game/contest $x_3$.
Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}). See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
$k_1=g_1$ is a team / play group together playing / playing with plaything / toy / game $k_2=g_2$; members are from set $g_3$ linked by relations $g_4$.
$x_1$ is a moving piece used in a game $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a board used for playing the game $x_2$.
Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}). See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.
$g_1$ is a game master/dungeon master for players $k_1=g_2$ in role-playing game $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a turn/move by player $x_2$ in game $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ has a body mass index of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ repeats $x_2$ (sedu'u/text) to audience $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$ for the $x_5$th time.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}). See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
Converts following cmevla or zoi-quote into a nonce interjection/attitudinal.
$x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
vocative: thanks - no thanks to you.
ckini modal, 1st place (related to) relatively; as a relation of ...
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].
$x_1=xa_1=g_1=k_1$ is a lance/spear/javelin/pointed-rod weapon for use against $x_2=xa_2$ by $x_3=xa_3$ of material $x_4=g_2$.
{kinli} {grana} {xarci}; this lujvo structure is from {noralujv}. The author of this definition is uncertain that {jesxa'i} would not be a better lujvo for the purpose.
$x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; 1$x_{1}$0**3] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro, minli)
$g_1$ is $g_2$ kilograms in mass by standard $g_3$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ kilometres long in direction $x_3$ by standard $x_4$.
$x_1$ is pottery made by $x_2$ of clay $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a potter who makes $x_2$ out of clay $x_3$.
krinu modal, 1st place (justified by) justifiably; because of reason ...
Also corridor; not typically a route between points, but offers access to sites along it. See also {naxle}, {panka}, {pluta}, {dargu}.
$x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.

Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly). See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by $x_{2}$ (quantifier) on scale $x_{3}$ (si'o).
Also count. See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.
One bel is equal to 10 decibels. Cf. {klani}, {sance}, {cladu}.
$x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
Also type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum. See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}). (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
korbi modal, 1st place (bordered by) bounded by ...
$x_1=z_1$ is at an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_2=k_2$ next-to/bordering-on $x_3=k_3$; $x_1=z_1$ skirts $x_2=k_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.

Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section. See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.
$x_1$ is a ladybug/ladybird/lady beetle of genus/species $x_2$.
Not necessarily with a gut skin; see also {tisycanti}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bituminous from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a cotyledon of seed $x_2$ of plant $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
(additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.
Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial. See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.
$x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
Also: on behalf of. See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.
$b_1$ is an amount of velvet/velour/towelling/tufted cloth of type/material $b_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion. See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.
$x_1$ is a shampoo for washing $x_2$'s hair, removing $x_3$, used by $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
"without evidence" refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction. See also {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification. See also {jemna}, {bisli}.
See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.
$x_1$ is a clove bud/tree of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_1$ is a crocodile (family Crocodylidae) of breed $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
[$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.
$x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
(adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend). See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
$x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
(cf. kurfa - needed for 'cube', bliku for a physical object; tanbo, tapla, tarmi)
$x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_1$ is Norwegian/pertains to Norwegian culture in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
(note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait). See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.
$x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}). See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.
$x_1=ka_1$ (agent) mines material/ore $x_2=ku_1=ka_2$ of type $x_3=ku_2$ from mine/source $x_4=ku_3=ka_3$ using tool $x_5=ka_4$.
Used in Theodore Reed's translation of A Princess of Mars.
$x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada). See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
$x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).

Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}). See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.
$x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$. See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.
$x_1$ is a spice of the mint family, with flavor $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a cruel-captain with object of cruelty-captained $x_{2}$.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
$x_1$ is a wolfberry/goji berry of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a white blood cell of the blood/pus $x_2$ of animal $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is lactic/dairy.
the referent of (indirect pointer); uses the referent of a sumti as the desired sumti.
$x_1$ has probability/likelihood $x_2$ of occurring under conditions $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ (force) lifts/applies raising/supporting force to $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$ in gravity well $x_{4}$.
($x_1$ may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.
name descriptor: the mass of individual(s) named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
name descriptor: the set of those named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
$x_1$ is quantifiable by quantifier $x_2$ on scale $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$g_3=l_1$ is a candle/wax light with wax source $l_2$.
$x_1$ is old/aged [relatively long in elapsed duration] by standard $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
Also touching, contiguous, against. See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is April of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
(cf. midju, nutli; fapro for balancing/opposing forces, nutli)
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.

Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ (selylanzu for reordered places); relative (= lazmi'u - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu). See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
$x_1$ is the Roman nation made up of people $x_2$
se la'ornai means the Roman people. The term refers to the ancient Romans, not to modern-day residents of the Italian capital, or small Wisconsin town.
$x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_1$ is a work of art created by an application of craft/skill $x_2$.
$f_1$ is an artist creating work of art $f_2=l_1$ in medium $l_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from elements/ideas $f_4$ .
$m_1$ is a gallery exhibiting $m_2$ at location $m_3$.
$x_1$ is-an-artist/produces $x_2$ by artistic application of skill/craft $x_3$.
$l_1$ is a widow spider of species $l_2$.

No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
klani modal, 1st place (amount) quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
$x_1$ is October of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
klesi modal, 1st place (scalar set) in/of category ...

Also confiscate, appropriate. Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied. (cf. punji, cpacu where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, vimcu for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, canci, cliva)
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
$x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
(adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.
$t_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles for observational activity $t_2$.
$ca_1$ is a keyboard for entering letters/symbols $l_1=cu_2$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.

Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol. See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.
$x_1$ is a jamo in syllable $x_2$ in writing system $x_3$ (default Hangul)
$s_1=p_1$ is a line in the text $s_2$.
$t_2$ is a text in medium $t_3$ with character set $l_2$.
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
the number/evaluated expression; convert number/operand/evaluated math expression to sumti.
$x_{1}$ precedes/leads $x_{2}$ in sequence $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is former/preceding/previous; $x_{2}$ is latter/following.

Also $x_1$ before, forerunner; leading, as in 'leading indicators'; $x_2$ after, trailing (= selyli'e for reordered {places}). See also cmavo list {li'e}, {balvi}, {ralju}, {rebla}, purci for time {sequence}, {jersi}, {porsi}, {jatna}, {farna}.
lidne modal, 1st place preceded by ...; non-time sequencing.

Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}). See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.
$x_1=f_1=s_2$ sublimates/evaporates from the solid state at temperature $x_2=f_2=s_3$ with vapor pressure $x_3=f_3$.
From {sligu} {febvi}; refers to a state change from solid to gas or vice versa, at the solid surface.
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
$x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.

Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= seljda for reordered {places}); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= selterjda for reordered {places}); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= terjda for reordered {places}); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}). See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.
$x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
A Japanese weapon consisting of two wooden sticks connected by a chain; also spelled ``nunchuku''
$x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
(cf. junta, tilju; se xalbo, kandi for metaphor)
$x_1$ is earlier than $x_2$ by amount of time $x_3$.
$c_1=t_1$ is the earliest among set / range $t_4$.
$lr_1=xa_1$ is / are the earliest person(s) to dwell/live/reside/abide at/inhabit/be a resident of location/habitat/nest/home/abode $xa_2$ among set / range $lr_2$.
$n_1$ is a drafting by author $l_3=t_1$ of story $l_1=t_2$ using method $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_{2}$ by storyteller $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.

Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= selterlisri for place {reordering}); note that the storyteller need not be the author. See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.
$x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.

Also roll, log. ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. porsi, girzu, cmima for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
Conditions include temperature and pressure. See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.
$x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
veridical descriptor: the one(s) that really is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
$b_1$ is the loglan/Loglan/logic language used by community $b_2$ to express ideas $b_3$.
Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.
Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}). See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.
$b_1$=$r_1$ is a cobblestone of material $b_2$=$r_2$ in floor $l_1$.
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
$x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is Earth's moon (default); $x_{1}$ is a major natural satellite/moon of planet $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ condenses/liquefies on/into $x_{2}$ at temperature $x_{3}$, pressure $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is dew/condensate on $x_{2}$.
the mass composed of; converts another description type to a mass composed of the members.
$t_1$ is a screwdriver for turning screw $k_1$
$x_1$ is Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
elidable terminator: end of sumti qualifiers; usually elidable except before a sumti.
pro-sumti: sumti question (what/who/how/why/etc.); appropriately fill in sumti blank.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s) & others unspecified.
$j_1$ is a valley between mountains/hills $c_1=j_2$ in terrain $c_2$.
$f_1$ is a canyon/ravine/chasm in mountain $f_2=c_1$ in terrain $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a derogative connotation/sense of $x_{2}$ used by $x_{3}$; $x_{3}$ derogates/'curses at' $x_{2}$ in form $x_{1}$.

Bloody (British sense), fucking, shit, goddamn. See also {palci}, {dapma}, {xlali}, {zabna}, {funca}, {ganti}, {ganxo}, {gletu}, {gutra}, {kalci}, {pinca}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {zargu}.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/process) is manual [not automatic] in function $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
marji modal, 1st place material in object/substance ...
$c_1=m_3$ is a wizard/sorcerer of $m_1=c_1$, which is magical to $m_2$, with standard of sorcery $c_3$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ millimeters of mercury by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is an amalgam of composition including $x_2$.
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
manri modal, 1st place (by standard 2) in reference frame ...

$x_1=s_1=m_1$ is the material environment/surrounding material (i.e. gaseous/liquid atmosphere, vacuum, etc.) enclosing $x_2=s_2$ in direction(s)/dimensions(s)/plane $x_3=s_3=m_3$, of type/composition including $x_4=m_2$.

A vacuum is arguably not 'material', but the word is much more convenient if that is included. Also, vacuum is never completely empty. See also {marji}, {sruri}, {gapci}, {litki}, {kunti}, {sakci}, {kensa}.
$v_4=m_1$ is a magnetic storage medium storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$g_1=m_1$ is an anglicism (in Lojban), inappropriate according to $m_3$.

Refers to any kind of reliance upon English in a Lojban expression, but is most common for calques. Is sometimes even extended to cover reliance upon cultural assumptions. ``malglico'' is a much more common form.
$mak_1$ is black magic to $mak_2$, performed by person/force/deity $mak_3$.
$m_1$ is a black widow spider of variety $m_2$.
$ma_1=mi_1=g_2$ is ill-lit with light $g_1$ from light source $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
$x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}). See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.
$mas_1$ is sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $mas_2$ (event/state) according to $mab_3$.
$n_1$ is dependant on/addicted to/can't go without drug/addictive substance $n_2$ due to type of addiction/withdrawal symptoms $x_3$ .
$x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
(cf. blabi, gusni, ctino; use kandi or xekri with colors, ctino)
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.
$n_1$ needs $n_2$ to be satisfied for reason $x_3$.
$n_2$ must be a physical object, not an event; for that, use {djica}. See also: {mansa}, {nitcu}
$mam_1$ is an ant queen of ants $mam_2=man_1$ of species/breed $man_2$.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
$x_1=l_1$ is a list of structure words $x_2=l_2=c_1$ of class(es) $x_5=c_2$ of language $x_6=c_3$ in order $x_3=l_3$ in medium $x_4=l_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_1$ is dodder of species/variety $x_2$ parasitic on $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}). See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.
See also {zdiraxa}, {andiroba}. "Azedarach" and variants have referred to both this tree and the {zdiraxa}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material. See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.
$x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_1$ is flaxseed/linseed produced by plant $x_2$, capable of growing into $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
(adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}). See also {grasu}, {kruji}.
$x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is June of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater) exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.
$d_1$ prefers $d_1=m_1$ (event/state) to $m_2$ for purpose $d_3$ by amount/excess $z_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is a crash (sound) produced by $m_1$ smashing into $m_2$.
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
mleca modal, 1st place (a lesser) undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$m_1=n_1$ is a negative number relative to origo $m_2$.
$m_1=t_1$ is the least of $m_2=t_4$ in property $m_3$ (ka/ni) by amount $m_4$.
$x_1$ is less than or equal to $x_2$ in property/quantity $x_3$ by amount $x_4$.
cmene modal, 1st place (requires quote) with name ...; so-called ...
$x_{1}$ is a million [1$x_{1}$0**6] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is the mass formed from set $x_{2}$ whose n member(s) are $x_{3}$.

[x1 is a mass with N components x3 composing set x2; x2 is an n-tuple (x2 is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); x1 forms an n-some; x3 (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of x2]; See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.
$x_1$ is an operator/mathematical function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_2$ to range $x_3$ defined by mathematical expression/rule $x_4$.
$x_1$ is the value of expression $x_2$ in base/convention $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an operand of operator $x_2$ filling place $x_3$ under rules/convention $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful. See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.
(adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}). See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.
$m_1$ is a psychologist/psychiatrist/counsellor/mental health practitioner of client $m_2$ treating ailment $m_3$ with treatment $m_4$.
$g_1$=$me_1$ telekinetically / with its mind moves $mu_1$ to destination/receiver $mu_2$ [away] from origin $mu_3$ over path/route $mu_4$
Made from {menli}+{muvgau}. {menli}2 dropped on account of irrelevancy. See also {gasnu}, {klama}, {litru}, {makfa}, {menli}, {muvdu}.
$x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$n_1$ is psychological warfare on the part of $d_1$.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
$m_1=b_1$ is the American English used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$m_1=g_1$ is the United States of America.
$m_1=j_1$ is a president of the United States of America.
Pertaining to the United States and Canada. Cf. {merko}, {kadno}, {bemro}, {bemjoitco}
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$t_1$ is a government of the United States of America.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
$c_1$ is a first person pronoun in language $c_4$.
Used instead of {mi} when a brivla is needed.
$m_1=g_1$ uses surgical implement $k_1$ to operate on organ(s) $k_2$ of patient $m_2$, as a treatment for ailment $m_3$.
$k_1$ is an operating theatre in which to perform surgery $m_4$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$n_1$ is an instruction for $n_2=m_3$ (event/state) to occur, issued by $n_3=m_1$ for intended recipient $n_4=m_2$.
$v_1$ is a command word/keyword ordering $v_2=m_3$ (event/state) in language $v_3$.
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity; identifies speaker.
$m_1=c_1$ demands/exacts $c_2=m_3$ of $c_3=m_2$, with manner/form of demand $c_4$.
$x_1=m_1=c_1$ expresses/states command $x_2=c_2$ to recipient(s) $x_3=m_2=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_4=c_4$.
$m_3$ of {minde} (the desired result) is presumably cointained in he expression of the command. $x_1$ commands $x_3$ with expression $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
$c_1$ is technology-oriented science fiction about plot/theme/subject $c_2$ by author $c_3$, based on technology $l_1$.
$x_1$ is a diameter between $x_2$ and $x_3$ of $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.

Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered {places}) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}). See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.
$x_{1}$ is a millionth [1$x_{1}$0**-6] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
$g_1$ is $g_2$ micrograms in mass (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; 1$x_{1}$0**-3] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

(cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a sequence of members $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, ... in that order.
The ordering rule is simply the order of the arguments, the unordered set is the set with members x2, x3, x4, ...
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
[also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.
$x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].

Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}). See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
(additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.
$x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.

Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector. $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection. See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.
$x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
(cf. panra, satci, mapti, simsa, drata, dunli, cmavo list du - which has no standard place, simxu)
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
$x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
